Reviews.Title: “A haven in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Dollarflyer
Reviews.Content: Often, especially in London, no matter how good the hotel escaping traffic may be more of an aspiration than realistic. Not at Hotel Orfila which proved a totally delightful city centre hotel which offered very personal service, excellent room, superb cuisine and peace and quiet. The staff were all very helpful and we were very grateful to Jose Martin Sanchez, Front Office Manager for defying the web site for a show, which clearly stated sold out, and found us tickets. Ensure you book at least one evening meal at the hotel restaurant and there will be no disappointment. The only mistake made was only coming for 2 nights. We hope to rectify that later this year.

Reviews.Title: “In keeping with Relais and Chateaux standards”
Reviews.Author: NJTTexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights before heading back to the States. So glad we turned in the rental car because it was not needed at all. The room was large with the European "kingsize" bed which was very comfortable. Although we were close to the elevator, we never heard it. My husband had injured his knee and the personnel went out of their way bringing ice and then heat packs for him. We did have our breakfast included which was very good. You could order from the menu if you were wanting more than a continental breakfast. We did order room service one night and it was also good. The Plaza Colon was close and was a stop for the double decker tour bus which we paid the 2-day fare. It was a great way to get introduced to the city. The hotel staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants and reserving for us. Would definitely go back and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful ultra-luxury hotel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SnowBirdInParadise
Reviews.Content: Located on a quiet and charming side street in heart of Madrid, the Orfilia is one of the most beautiful and romantic hotels in all of Europe. From the moment you arrive in the lobby, you are surrounded by elegance and class. The rooms are very large and plush, tastefully decorated with art work and vintage furnishings. The service and attention to detail by the staff is above all expectations.The hotel restaurant is a gourmet delight! For starters we had a delightful watermelon foam appitizer and smoked mussels in sauce, followed by a scrumptous consume. For our main course I had the venison and my husband had the grilled octopus. Each dish was perfectly prepared and served in an elegant style. The Orfilia has everything you would expect in a world class hotel and much much more. We look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Orfila”
Reviews.Author: ChathamA
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor on line helped inform my choice of Hotel Orfila which we booked five months in advance of our stay. Located in a quiet neighborhood, close to the Plaza Colon, the hotel could not be better sited-- a short bus ride away from the major museums and shopping. The hotel is elegant, small, well maintained, and the staff most accommodating (making restaurant recommendations and reservations, storing some of our luggage while we visited Ronda and Toledo for a few days, organizing taxis, etc.). Breakfasts were delicious as was the one dinner we had, our final night. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for its charm, elegance, character, convenience, and alert and gracious staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel In A Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: Tarahyll
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this very comfortable hotel which is centrally located in the city of Madrid. Our room was large, comfortable and very quiet. The staff in general were excellent. Room prices are quite expensive and in general do not include breakfast. I'd suggest taking breakfast in a nearby cafe.

Reviews.Title: “4 days in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Harriet M
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights in the Hotel Orfila in Madrid. Apart from its great location within walking distance of the Prado and all the museums in that area, it is also close to the wonderful shopping streets of Calle de Serano and the smaller Spanish boutiques. However, the best thing about it, is its wonderful staff. Nothing was too much trouble - booking great tables at a moments notice, translating into spanish anything we needed to know, finding obscure shops that we had been told about in England and remembering exactly what each member of our party usually requested for breakfast. Our one free dinner which was part of the package, was the best food he had in Madrid. I could recommend it more highly. Harriet

Reviews.Title: “A very nice boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MarcioRosa
Reviews.Content: We have been at Orfila Hotel in late december. It is a very nice boutique hotel, located in a quiet street nearby the Plaza de Còlon in a walking distance from the old city and the Bourbon district. The staff is attentive and very polite and they take care of any order quickly. We stayed in a very confortable room with all the facilities. The breakfast (included in the rate) is incredible with "jamòn iberico" and different kinds of cheese. We stayed for 3 nights and have a fantastic dinner in the beautiful restaurant. I suggest you try the perfect cochinillo (crispy pork), even better than the served in the famous Botin, also in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Best service we've had. Lovely small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TheFrog59
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with one evening dinner in their restaurant. Everything was perfect, (and I'm generally pretty hard to please). The service (Front Desk, restaurant, breakfast) was fantastic - courteous, unobtrusive but ever-present, helpful, personalised. A real pleasure. The restaurant meal was with an invited Mexican chef (Gastronomic festival time in Madrid) and was outstanding. Location of the hotel is in a very quiet sidestreet, 3mins walk from convenient place to pick up the Madrid tour bus, taxis, etc. Our first time in Madrid (fabulous city) and the hotel made it an excellent weekend. Just for info: cost of taxi to/from airport was 23€ each way, including the 5.50€ bagage supplement. Pleased to see that other reviews are in line with ours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and personalised service”
Reviews.Author: Lostinlondonandmore
Reviews.Content: I love Madrid and I love this area. And now I've found a small lovely hotel to go with it! Also, I got a great deal through e-bookers which made it affordable. Would recommend it for business as well as pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Hotel Orfila”
Reviews.Author: monkeyluvs
Reviews.Content: A charming small hotel with perfect service! Our room was on the 4th floor and faced the back, there was absolutely no noise from outside. The bed was the most comfortable we ever slept in. Large bathroom with a whirlpool bath and a separate room with a toilet and a bidet. Perfect little amenities, chocolates on pillows, plush towels, bathrobes and slippers.Adorable little cards at bedside every night with weather info for the next day. There is a beautiful lobby and a charming bar/tea room. We did not have an occaision to dine at the hotel but cafe con leche was delicious. The best part of this hotel is their client service - from the bellboys to the waiters - polite and prompt. But the front desk manager Jose is the absolute treasure. He made us feel so welcome and cared for, we did not want to leave. He arranged for dinner reservations, train tickets, taxis, cold medicine, etc - and all with easy charm and a smile. Thank you so much for making our favorite city even better!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous reproductions!”
Reviews.Author: polina_m_80
Reviews.Content: Reproductions on walls have very much liked. The best combination to an interior anywhere didn't see. And the carpet has seemed to me is rather dirty-grey, probably for a long time didn't clean as follows. It's necessary to pay attention. In number silently. Came with the husband for some days. Him on affairs, I on shops. The hotel has left good impression, despite of some lacks. Arrangement of hotel simply fantastic - museums, park, shops near by. The personnel schooled. Has walked on museums, shops with pleasure and back in cosy silence of hotel. Restaurant in hotel is expensive. Wine quite good, meal decent. The restaurant near to hotel, a pleasant interior, good service, meal and twice cheaper has liked more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: DiscoverMendoza
Reviews.Content: Hotel Orfila is located in a priviledged area. A very quiet 1 block street (calle Orfila) near Paseo de la Castellana and Colon square. At night you cannot hear a single noise, which is very much appreciated for such a big city as Madrid. Breakfast is taken in a beautiful room overlooking a manicured winter garden (just gorgeous!). Privacy is the word that most describes this petit hotel. Service is wonderful, always cheerful, ready to help. Chef David makes wonderful chocolates and superb modern yet tasty food. Rooms are very well appointed with extra towels, bidet soap & small towels, facials, comfortable robes and branded amenities. Our stay was too short unfortunately, we hope to come back soon as we had a great time at this hotel. It felt more than our home. Thank you Severino, Mr. Garcia and the friendly & warm staff at Hotel Orfila.

Reviews.Title: “Discret Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Frederic S
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in thiis Relais Châteaux, 28 October to November 2nd, 2011. For vacation and discovery of Madrid. We have to say that both of us travel worldwide in our jobs, and we spend more than 100 nights per year in differnt hotels! Orfila Madrid was a revelation. Very central location, quiet street, walking distance to Salamanca and to the Prado... The room (we has the simplest room 46) was huge compared to what we know in Madrid. Furnished with taste, in classical style, as we expected from a Relais Châteaux. Very functional amenities. Certainly, what got us absolutely stunned is tha absolute charming and attentionate, personalized service from each person of the staff! And their attention did not seem invasive, nor commercial, but genuinly friendly and extremely professional! Orfila is not the type of large business hotels... It is a small charming and cosy place, where you feel "at home"... Thank you, all Orfila staff! From now on, this is our "home" in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Yeneda
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at hotel Orfila, very friendly and helpful staff, very good breakfast, quiet. Hotel is a little tired and needs refurbishment but It is not run down. Well located.

Reviews.Title: “Update on my June 2011 Review”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm072
Reviews.Content: This is not the place for those that like Impersonal Big International Chain Hotels! We are old sticklers and always stayed in the same room on the 1st floor. This stay the front desk manager, Jose, suggested we stay in a room on the 4th floor directly above our first floor room. My wife reluctantly went to see the room. We found out for the first time, on our fourth stay in the past 12 months, that a "matrimonial bed" is what we call a double bed. What a plus! We had incorrectly assumed that only twin beds were available. Henceforth the room on the fourth floor will become our regular room in our home from home in Madrid. The Hospitality and Ambiance of Hotel Orfila is exceptional. Weather permitting try the terrace for a meal, a drink or even just your morning coffee. Meals in the restaurant are a must! The chef is excellent and the table service impeccable. But you would expect nothing less from a Relais & Chateaux establisment. We look forward to our next stay which unfortunately will only be in mid 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Old school charm in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: hungryperson
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Orfila is an charming, old-fashioned sort of hotel. It's in a good location in the quiet embassy district of Madrid and close to the shops, Prado, Thyssen museum etc. Lots of nice touches. There's a good breakfast (about 25 euros unless it's included in the room rate) and a lovely little terrace bar/restaurant. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. There was free wi-fi in the room and throughout the hotel, which is very helpful. The service was attentive but occasionally a bit idiosyncratic. For example, there was a bottle of champagne in our room when we arrived but we couldn't persuade the staff to send up any ice when we actually wanted to drink it. Our 'romance package' promised candles by the bath but this consistented of four tea-lights, which cheap rather than romantic, in my view. Getting information about the hotel and making a restaurant reservation took a bit more effort than you'd expect in a luxury hotel. But this may have been a bit of a language issue. Our suite was spacious, quiet and comfortable but I agree with other commenters that the decor, especially in the common parts, needs a bit of a refresh. New carpets wouldn't hurt. But overall, a very nice stay and a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay in a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: santanaep
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Orfila several times over the last 6 years. Great location, rooms, cleanliness and service. However, the decor is getting a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, quiet 5-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisH3040
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Relais & Chateaux Hotels, which are famous for their luxury and attentiveness, both which were in abundance at this hotel. From the very personal service at the front desk, to the extremely comfortable beds and quiet rooms, we felt pampered during our entire stay! Our two rooms (14 & 15) overlooked the beautiful green courtyard and the large bathrooms, with separate toilets made getting ready quite easy! The hotel is difficult to find-our cab driver had to ask other cabbies for directions. (I would recommend bringing the address with you!) The location is a bit off the beaten track, located in a residential area so this is why it's so quiet. We never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a cab to anywhere. We also took the hop on, hop off bus but found it much easier to hop-off than on! It was always full, especially when trying to get a rooftop seat. Restaurants recommended by the hotel were exceptional, especially the Restaurante Nuevo Saint James! Great service and paella but watch for the VERY pricey recommended appetizers of shrimp! Over 100 Euros for 8 pieces and we were not forewarned of the cost!! Definitely visit El Prado museum, the Palacio Real and enjoy outdoor lunch with Sangria anywhere in the Plaza Nuevo. The street performers make for an enjoyable afternoon!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyJDallas
Reviews.Content: We travel a great deal and cannot praise Hotel Orfila and it's staff enough. In short, Hotel Orfila is one of those special places that manage to be professional and intimate at the same time. We stayed twice in the past few weeks, and both stays were just perfect. The staff was so friendly and helpful - and so knowledgeable - that they made us truly feel as if we were at the home of friends. The restaurant would be a destination for us in any city - in fact, we cancelled our reservations at Botin so we could eat at Orfila's restaurant a second time - do not miss the lobster salad. Do not miss Hotel Orfila.

Reviews.Title: “An Unforgettable Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: BJLaB
Reviews.Content: In planning our first trip to Spain to celebrate our 44th anniversary, we consulted Tripadvisor in hopes of finding a special hotel in Madrid. There we read glowing reviews of the wonderful Relais & Chateaux Hotel Orfila, which included mention of an exceptional front desk person named Emilio. His professionalism, kindness and helpfulness were highly praised. So I e-mailed Emilio to ask if the lovely luxury/boutique Hotel Orfila might have a senior rate for our quiet, private little anniversary stay. Emilio's response, after consulting with his front desk manager, was truly exceptional. The accommodations far exceeded our fondest dreams, and the chilled champagne and fresh fruit ("for our special celebration") were most welcome after our six hour drive from Bilbao. Emilio even volunteered to help my husband negotiate Madrid traffic to return our rental car on his way home after work! His friendly helpfulness continued every day of our stay. Genuine kindness and consideration abound throughout the lovely Hotel Orfila from the impeccable dinner service of waiter Jose Maria in the Hotel's intimate garden restaurant to the personal attention of front desk manager Jose. Upon our departure. Jose saved us a great deal of time and stress by personally checking on our departure terminal at the airport and instructing the taxi driver accordingly. Location on a quiet, tree-lined street, 19th century historic elegance, walking distance to major museums, fine restaurants, and chic shopping combined to make the Hotel Orfila our perfect choice--but it is Emilio and the wonderful staff that will bring us back to the Hotel Orfila whenever we are fortunate enough to return to beautiful Madrid--hopefully, before our 50th (also-sure-to-be-memorable) anniversary! It is surely no coincidence that Relais & Chateaux is now our favorite hotel group!

Reviews.Title: “Home from home in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm072
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Hotel Orfila in the past 10 months, this time for 13 nights. We will be back again in Sept/Oct 2011. We don't like big International Hotels. Boutique, comfort and service oriented hotels are always our preference. We use Relais & Chateaux affiliated hotels extensively and in Hotel Orfila we have found a gem in the heart of a big, bustling city. The cosiness really makes this a home from home for us. The staff from the front desk to the restaurant to house keeping are incredible. Nothing is too much trouble! Besides the world renowned museums, the front desk plans our stay with us; great restaurants, great day trip excursions, entertainment, theatres, flamenco, ballet and much more. It all runs seamlessly! We really enjoy our relaxed breakfasts and coffee on the secluded terrace, weather permitting. More often than not we dine in the restaurant whose chef is very good, as is the impecable table service, always a good wine recommendation, Spanish of course, to compliment the meal. Our room, we always stay in the same room, is spacious and comfortable. Orfila is situated in a quiet side street very close, couple of minutes walking, to Plaza de Colon and Plaza Alonso Martinez, both with Metro stops. A short stroll, a must, down Paseo de Recoletos from Plaza de Colon brings you to the famous museums. The Serrano shopping area, everything a woman could want, is a block from Plaza de Colon. The Parque Del Buen Retiro is a block off Paseo de Recoletos. We love strolling in this park. In all a GEM of an Hotel. Malcolm and Janine Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & Charming Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie M
Reviews.Content: The Orfila is elegant; centrally located close to Embassy Row; small & intimate with a fabulous kitchen and dining room. Part of the exclusive R&C association of five-star small hotels, the Orfila won't disappoint. The staff is attentive, the rooms are comfortable and well provisioned; and, every client need is anticipated. A wonderful alternative to the big, old and sometimes stuffy regulars. The Orfila is not a modern boutique, it's a classic and elegant Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: PDXTraveler_98
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 nights at the hotel as a highlight of our 2 week trip to Spain and France. The staff are friendly, professional, and ready to do whatever it takes to make guests feel welcome and cared for. The location, though a bit off the beaten tourist path, is perfect as a start-the-day and end-the-evening haven, quiet and elegant. By the second night, we were referring to the Orfila as "home"!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel you would like to stay in anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: kleetraveler3
Reviews.Content: This year I stayed at Hotel Orfila the third time. I brought a firend and his wife from Chicago, USA. I think they both were very impressed with the services and the accommodations of Hotel Orfila. This hotel is conveniently positioned to access to various tourist spots, i.e. the Prado, downtown area, subway stations, bus stops,etc. Their services are really exemplary and courteous. The restaurant serves the finest Frenchized Spanish cuisines., since this place is a part of Relais & Chateau chain anyway. If you would like to stay and taste the fine Spanish flavor, I highly recommend this hotel is the place you should stay when you are in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: cooks2
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with wonderful helpful staff to match. The staff could not do enough to help make our four days in Madrid a success. From going to the train station to pick up tickets for our trip to Barcelona, to helpful suggestions on restaurants and museums, each of the staff we were lucky to have encountered was by and far superior in customer care. Although the hotel could use a little sprucing up (wall paper, carpet, etc.) it made for a memorable trip. Truly a first class hotel in a first class city.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and service in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Boardroom
Reviews.Content: The Orfila is ideally located for access to central Madrid yet it is on a very quiet street. It was selected because it advertised traditional quality and service. We were not disappointed. Friendly charm met us upon arrival and was present throughout our four day stay. Every request was promptly obliged and we felt we were welcome guests rather than just passing through. The Orfila will suit those looking for traditional comfort and service and may not suit those looking for modern chic and gadgetry. The best compliment is confirmation that we would undoubtedly return to the Orfila when the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond compare!”
Reviews.Author: KRRI
Reviews.Content: We are staying at Hotel Orfila in March and are trying to plan many of the dining details ahead of time. I sent an email to the hotel with my request and he has already taken care of every last one of them. One of the restaurants wasn't available so he VERY kindly suggested and made a reservation at another restaurant that has a similar menu. How wonderful to find a person willing to make so much effort BEFORE a guest even arrives. If it's this great before we arrive, I can only imagine how wonderful it will be when we arrive!

Reviews.Title: “A Paradise on Earth.”
Reviews.Author: VFostroy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel twice, once in December and once in January- and I must say that both experiences left me with an incredibly good opinion of this little gem in Madrid. The staff is extremely helpful and accommodating, the food is delicious, the location of the Hotel couldn't be better and the absolute comfort of it is almost overwhelming. I like to walk to my destinations, and by staying in this hotel I had to walk close to nothing to go everywhere! Located about 20 minutes away from the best Museums in town, as well as not even 5 minutes away to the closest Metro stations this is the one of the best Relais & Chateaux in Spain. Furthermore, the staff was always really helpful with restaurant and Flamenco tablaos recommendations. If I could give this hotel 10 stars I would without a second thought. It's simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie_and_Nikolas
Reviews.Content: Relais & Châteaux Orfila Hotel gets the highest rate possible for the professionalism of its staff (especially the reception staff) - bravo! Y que todo le vaya bien!

Reviews.Title: “i wish i could live in it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tuky2004
Reviews.Content: Hotel Orfila...fantastic...wonderful...what else can i say? The service was excellent, the food (my husband is a chef) was very, very good, as good as the waiting staff in the restaurant. The rooms were nice and big, enough space to feel comfortable. And last but not least, on the other way...saving the best for last...the recepcionist, Jose Martin, he was exceptional, very helpfull and his english was really good, very nice person. As i said, i wish o could have a permanent room!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the bustle of Madid”
Reviews.Author: rodbin
Reviews.Content: I really can not believe that the review by micaela84 is about the same hotel I am glad that review was not live when I booked the Orfila. Initially I wanted to stay in the Atlantica because of the reviews in TA but they did not answer two emails So further searches and we opted for the Orfila it was a little more at 210€ than we wanted to pay for a 4 night stay in Madrid but with parking included and a Chateau Relais we decided to book it. After a vey hectic drive into Madrid including getting lost in the new underground road system with no GPS and no idea where to go We eventually got back into daylight and with the GPS working again and after 20 minutes of negotiating heavy traffic and crowded streets we arrived in a very quiet road in front of the Orfila. We were immediately met by a very smart manager who new our names, arranged the unloading and parking of our car. Our spirits lifted as we entered the peaceful graceful reception area, the hotel was all a Relais Chateau should be. Our room was perfect, huge bed large bathroom with Jacuzzi bath; the room faced the inner courtyard and was the quietest city hotel room we have ever had. The staff were fantastic nothing was too much trouble excellent directions and advice on where to go, they even booked and collected our train tickets to Toledo. The beds were turned at night with fresh towels and chocolates. On the second night we had a knock on the door and were presented with a bottle of sherry and two glasses with complements of the management. We did not eat in the restaurant or take the breakfast at 25€ each we felt it was a little pricey but other residents we met said the breakfast was very good. There are plenty of restaurants nearby Enzos, Basilica, Bice. But be aware a lot of them do not open until after 20.30 Madrid is a fantastic city and we found the Orfila was well situated located in a very quiet area but within comfortable walking distance to most of the important places and very close to the excellent Madrid subway. The Orfila is a perfect choice to make your visit to Madrid very special.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: schadwick1021
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, amazing staff very helpfull and great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about the hotel is excellent and situated in a quiet area”
Reviews.Author: NielStellenbosch
Reviews.Content: After staying in Paris for a week the Orfila was a great treat- excellent value for money and the best service imaginable. Everything is in walking distance from the hotel and the front desk staff were exceptionally helpful. This helped to make a 6 day stay in Mdrid most memoreable. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location and very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: JammyNotts
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Orfila it was so comfortable and peaceful after a day sightseeing in Madrid. It was a good 20 minute very pleasant walk to museums. The staff are brilliant and my hsband particularly loved the boutique and more personnal feel to the hotel. On the downside taxi drivers found it difficult to locate and the breakfasts were 25 euros each for a continental breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danieli1970
Reviews.Content: I only can say it's a fantantic boutique hotel. IT's lovely the terrace and the small garden. But the best of the Hotel Orfila ...the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location for business, museums, etc.”
Reviews.Author: richhurl
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 1 night in this elegant hotel. At first, the Orfila is not obviously superb, but in short measure one notices the small details: linen sheets, great mattresses, free WiFi, original art, etc. The staff provide excellent service as well. Dinner was very good, as was the breakfast, which provides a combination of buffet with eggs to order. The location is unsurpassed, on a quiet side street, but within walking distance of the Prado.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeighCole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orfila for a few days recently. We had a very comfortable jumior suite. The hotel wasquite lovely6, very comfortable. The jurnio suite was not really a suit. It was one large room rather than a bedroom and small sitting room. The room was clean and very comfortable. The hotel is sufficiently small that the front desk personnel double as concierges. While they were friendly and tried to be helpful, there were wide gaps in their knowledge of thngs. For example, we wanted to go to El Escorial and the front desk person told us the trains left every few minutes from Recoletos station. While it is true that trians left from there every few minutes, the train to El Ecorial left every hour, so we had to wait 50 minutes. Also, we arrived on a Monday and robes and slippers did not arrive in our suit until Wednesday, which is typical of service in Spain. We had started our vacation (with two separate stays in Madrid) at the Ritz. Frankly, combining the comfort of the Orfila with the service at he Ritz wouls result in a perfect hotel. As ot wwas, we would stay in either hotel again, but all things being equal, for the exstra 100 euro a night would choose the Ritz because of the service. Nonethelesss, the room at he Orfila was superior and we would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: Fluffytowels
Reviews.Content: A charming small hotel, centrally located and well appointed. The restaurant was going through a menu change and was disappointing. However, the front desk service was the best we have experienced. A delightful stay

Reviews.Title: “worst 5-star-hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Arne3
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Hotel Orfila, Madrid from 22/09-2009 until 25/09-2009 was our worst 5-star-hotel experience ever! Compared with the official standard the hotel does not meet our expatiations at all. Examples: 1. We could not use the spa in the bathroom due to lack of cleaning. Every time we try to use the spa, the basin was filled with black mould coming out from the tubes – disgusting! And the cleaning standard in the room was not sufficient either. 2. During the check-in procedure the receptionist presented a letter with dinner offerings. But in the restaurant later the same evening we were not able to get any of the menu-suggestions – the waiter and the cook simply did not know the suggestions! Then we try to order dishes from the “a la carte menu”, but several of the dishes could not be served (although there were only a few guests in the restaurant). “Sold out” was the answer. And the wine from the wine list we decided to drink was unfortunately also “sold out”. The table-cloth was not ironed and the table-cloth was with several spots of dirt – Uh!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent after upgrade”
Reviews.Author: AntwerpSippi
Reviews.Content: After arriving at the hotel, the first room (superior room for which we have booked) was really dark and awfull. We've got another superior room on the 3rd floor but there was a problem with water in the bathroom which could not be fixed immediately. The all thing was during a lot, we were losing our time. Finally the director proposed us the suite which was marvellous! we've got this suite as an upgrade. All the rest of the hotel is excellent; breakfast, furniture, service, staff (even they did not spoke english), dinner we recommend not to choose the superior room or executive room because it is not worth it. Best to do is standard room who are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel with personal service”
Reviews.Author: Embarcadero1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 nights in late July while I was in Madrid for business. It's a deluxe, small hotel with very good, personalized service. The room was very comfortable and the bath included a tub with jacuzzi. Very nice for relaxing after a long day of work. The bed and linens were very, ver ynice. I also appreciated the blackout curtains and small sitting area. The hotel staff left a bottle of sherry twice during my stay - a very nice touch. I did not eat in the restaurant, but did have some room service, which was quite nice. There is a small bar which is really just a waiting area for the restaurant. I was able to have a beer and read the paper outside in the restaurant before they started seating people at 9. The front desk staff are fantastic. They were quick with suggestions, very helpful at every opportunity and always made me feel welcome. The service was one of the best parts of my stay and is the main reason I would go back. I liked that it was on a quiet side street in a residential area. This was part of the reason I chose to stay here. I was a 10 minute subway ride from where I was working. I was willing to give up a fantastic view for quiet. It's in a wealthy neighborhood with lots of embassies. It felt very, very safe. I walked to Chueca (and good food) in 10 minutes. The hotel does have a few drawbacks. There was no desk in my room , which meant I had to put my laptop on the dresser. They haven't quite worked out how to provide internet services either. They should just give away wifi rather than wasting so much time (mine and their staff's) trying to sell it. Other than these glitches, the hotel was very good. I give it a solid 4 stars. To get 5, they would have to improve their rooms and facilities (access to a gym would be a help). I would definitely stay here if when I go back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: pamperednyc
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in historic building. Nice sized room that was clean and well equipped. Front desk was very friendly and tried to be helpful however it seemed as if they are more used to business travellers than tourists as they weren't that well versed on basic tourist attractions and/or hot new restaurants, etc. If you know where you want to go and what you want to do, then this wouldn't be an issue. No true concierge per se. Hotel is in a quiet residential area that is only a 5 -10 minute walk to an area filled with restaurants, shopping and tourist attractions, however it is somewhat off the beaten track. Great breakfast (although pricey), friendly and clean in general. Extremely charming appeal. Overall a good hotel despite the above critiques. I'd probably try someplace else next time but would stay here again if nothing else seemed appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic weekend!”
Reviews.Author: AGSM
Reviews.Content: Fantastic small hotel! We stayed 5 nights for an anniversary weekend and it couldn't have been better!! Location is perfect, tucked down a quiet side street, so it really an oasis of peace in a noisy, hectic city where people don't even start going out to dinner before 9pm. Off a side street from Plaza Colon, at first our taxi driver had trouble finding it - always a good sign. Rooms are large, tastefully decorated and well appointed, particularly those at the back, and we found the staff extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Madrid seems to be filling up with ultrahip design hotels which have no character and charge you a whack - the Orfila is not cheap, but great. There's a subway two blocks away, but as Madrid is really a city to walk and enjoy, we walked everywhere - the Prado and museums are only a 15-20 minute walk away. There is no shortage of excellent tapas bars and restaurants in the Chueca area which is no more than 10 minutes's walk. It's always a risk booking online, but in this case it was (for us anyhow) a risk well-rewarded. Can thoroughly recommend it for a romantic weekend in one of the most fun cities in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: DOlivier
Reviews.Content: I came here because work booked me in this hotel for two nights, and it exceeded my expectations. The rooms were very large, very clean, and the staff threw in details such as a complementary bottle of sherry on arrival, and an evening forcast of the next day's weather written on a small card next to your pillow when housekeeping make up the rooms. The hotel itself was situtated on a quiet street, perfect when you need to get things done. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, comfortable, friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in summer 2005 - horrifically high temperatures, and the hotel was a welcome refuge to come back to. Traditionally furnished but very comfortable. Staff very friendly and very helpful - even when we arrived for check-in hours before normal time. Really good breakfast buffet. Just down the road from the AC Mauro, where the staff (presumably used to Posh and Becks and not interested in lesser beings) couldn't have been more UNfriendly if they'd tried! There are trendier hotels, and more central (as in, close to the museums) hotels, but this is a good one, very friendly, and only a few minutes from the shops of the Salamanca district, or the round-town tour buses. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at Orfila”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent five perfect nights at Hotel Orfila in Madrid. Staff is very friendly, English-speaking, and wonderfully accomodating. Clientelle seemed mostly European, very upscale and sophisticated.This small, traditionally furnished hotel is beautifully restored and rooms are very plushly decorated, with large bathrooms and very comfortable living space. Good breakfast buffet and also several cafes nearby. Location is one of the best assets, near Plaza de Colon in a very upscale neighborhood. The subway stop is about three blocks away, or you can take a 15-minute walk down the stunning Paseo de Recoletos to the main street, Gran Via. Nearby neighborhoods in walking distance are Salamanca (Madrid's best neighborhood, lots of shopping and restaurants) and Chueca for late-night dining and barhopping. There are many cafes and bars within walking distance, as well as taxi stands three blocks away on Calle Genova. You definitely get more than you pay for at this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a great trip to Madrid, Spain. During my time there I stayed at the Hotel Orfila. I was very impressed with the level of service and the ambiance of the hotel. It was pretty, very clean and located on a nice, quiet street within walking distance of key venues and attractions. The hotel staff was lovely and very accomodating. They went out of their way to make my stay a very enjoyable one. They were helpful, friendly and very professional. I highly recommend this hotel! It was a real pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at this excellent hotel, ideally located in the center of Madrid. The main characteristic of this hotel is discretion: located on a quite street, it is an old building exquisitely adapted for the hotel, with none of the bragadoccio associated with the main chains. The service is superb, the rooms are large and quiet (most of them with no views), and it has a small restaurant with patio. The only drawback is price: it is an expensive hotel. But if you are looking for a quiet, low-key luxurious hotel, this is the place.
